I wanted a simple wallet that would hold my day-to-day cards and keys, as well as an airtag. 
This post shares a downloadable PDF of the pattern I came up with.


::: {layout-ncol=2}

![The card side of the wallet with two levels of pockets.](imgs/DSC_2008.png){group="gallery"}

![The keys-and-airtag side of the wallet, all folded up.](imgs/DSC_2004.png){group="gallery"}

![With the wings open, the keys are accessible. The airtag is hiding in its little panel.](imgs/DSC_1989.png){group="gallery"}

![The airtag is inserted and removed through an opening in the panel's side seam.](imgs/DSC_1996.png){group="gallery"}
:::


**Wallet specs:**

- Dimensions with wings folded in: approx 118mm *  70mm * 22mm.
- Easily holds an airtag, a handful of keys, and up to four cards. 


**Materials I used:**

- **Leather:** 1.2â€“1.4mm-thick undyed veg tan leather. I used scraps left over from my barefoot boots, or the wallet requires one A4/letter-sized sheet.
- **Thread:** Mercerised crochet cotton from a charity shop, waxed before sewing.
- **Snaps:** Prym 15mm snaps, 2x front (the receiving end) and 2x back (the inserting end). Smaller snaps would also work fine.


**Download PDF of the pattern and step-by-step instructions:**

- [A4 paper](../../documents/key-card-airtag-A4.pdf){target="_blank"}
- [letter paper](../../documents/key-card-airtag-letter.pdf){target="_blank"}

Print the pattern page at 100% scale, and check the size of the printout using the scaling squares.
